segments.en: And today we're going to be bringing you a great lesson that's talking about a bank robbery.
segments.cn: 今天我们将为您带来一堂关于银行抢劫的精彩课程。

segments.en: Yes, and this is an important lesson for all of our future bank robbers out there.
segments.cn: 是的，这对我们未来的银行抢劫者来说是重要的一课。

segments.en: Yeah, we are going to teach you some words that you would use for planning a bank robbery, but you can apply them to other situations.
segments.cn: 我们将教你一些用于策划银行抢劫的词汇，但你也可以将它们应用于其他情况。

segments.en: Yeah, I hope you apply them to other situations.
segments.cn: 是的，我希望你能将它们应用于其他情况。

segments.en: Hopefully you won't Rob a bank.
We don't want to be responsible for any crimes you can commit.
segments.cn: 我们不想对你可能犯下的任何罪行负责。

segments.en: All right, so why don't we start by looking at some of the vocabulary in Vocabulary Preview?
segments.cn: 好吧，那我们先来看看词汇预览中的一些词汇吧？

segments.en: We have one word for you today that you'll hear in the dialogue, and it is filling in.
segments.cn: 今天我们有一个在对话中会听到的词，那就是“填补”。

segments.en: So to fill in for somebody, right?
That means that you are replacing them.
segments.cn: 这意味着你在替代他们。

segments.en: So if Marco can't host the show today, maybe Danny will fill in.
segments.cn: 所以如果Marco今天不能主持节目，也许Danny会填补。

segments.en: Okay, so to take the place of someone.
Okay, so now let's listen to our dialogue.
segments.cn: 现在让我们听听我们的对话。

segments.en: Let's listen to this bank robbery.
segments.cn: 让我们听听这个银行抢劫。

segments.en: All right, so this is what we're going to do.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们要做的。

segments.en: Mr. Rabbit, you and Mr. Fox will go to the bank wearing these uniforms.
segments.cn: 兔子先生，你和狐狸先生将穿着这些制服去银行。

segments.en: We've managed to get replicas of the one the guards wear for when they pick up the money.
segments.cn: 我们设法得到了保安在取钱时穿的制服的复制品。

segments.en: When you get inside, tell them that you're filling in for Carl and Tom, and say that they're on another route today.
segments.cn: 进到里面后，告诉他们你是Carl和Tom的替代者，并说他们今天在另一个路线。

segments.en: What if they want to call and confirm?
segments.cn: 如果他们想打电话确认怎么办？

segments.en: We have the phones tapped, so the call will be patched through to me, and I'll pretend to be the transport company.
segments.cn: 我们已经监听了电话，所以电话会转接给我，我会假装是运输公司。

segments.en: Only take as much money as you can fit in these bags.
segments.cn: 只拿你能装进这些袋子里的钱。

segments.en: Well, it sounds like a pretty interesting plan.
segments.cn: 嗯，这听起来是个相当有趣的计划。

segments.en: It does sound like a plan.
I guess we'll have to maybe talk a little bit about that later.
segments.cn: 我想我们可能得稍后再谈谈这个。

segments.en: Let's take a look at the language that we saw in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 让我们看看在语言收获中看到的语言。

segments.en: Okay, we heard five really great words in this dialogue that I'd like to look at now in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好吧，我们在这个对话中听到了五个非常好的词，我想现在在语言收获中看看。

segments.en: So let's go to the first one.
segments.cn: 所以让我们来看第一个。

segments.en: Um, now we heard the boss say that they got replicas of the uniforms.
segments.cn: 嗯，我们听到老板说他们得到了制服的复制品。

segments.en: So it's, this is really easy.
Something that's a replica is a copy.
So for example, in Las Vegas there's a replica of the Eiffel Tower of Paris.
segments.cn: 例如，在拉斯维加斯有一个巴黎埃菲尔铁塔的复制品。

segments.en: Yes, actually I lived in a small city where there was also a replica of the Eiffel Tower.
segments.cn: 是的，实际上我住在一个小城市，那儿也有一个埃菲尔铁塔的复制品。

segments.en: Well, there are a lot of replicas.
Even now on the street maybe you can see replica watches.
segments.cn: 甚至现在在街上你可能会看到复制手表。

segments.en: That's supposedly a Rolex, but they're not.
segments.cn: 那个据说是劳力士，但其实不是。
还有很多很多其他东西。

segments.en: Alright, so let's take a look at the next word.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看下一个词。

segments.en: So if you tap someone's phone, you do something to the telephone line so that you can hear their conversations, right?
segments.cn: 所以如果你监听某人的电话，你会对电话线路做一些事情，以便你可以听到他们的对话，对吧？

segments.en: Right, and actually the police do this sometimes, right?
segments.cn: 对，实际上警察有时会这样做，对吧？

segments.en: Right, you see it in movies all the time.
segments.cn: 对，你在电影中经常看到。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah, you connect a wire to the phone so you can listen to the conversation.
segments.cn: 是的，是的，你连接一根线到电话上，这样你就可以听到对话。

segments.en: Exactly, so you tap the telephone.
So in our dialogue they tapped the bank's phone, right?
segments.cn: 所以在我们的对话中，他们监听了银行的电话，对吧？

segments.en: And he said if they make a call, he will patch the call through to him.
segments.cn: 他说如果他们打电话，他会把电话转接给他。

segments.en: Now we still use this today.
segments.cn: 现在我们今天仍然使用这个。

segments.en: Like if you call an office, right, and you say, oh can you patch me through to Carol?
segments.cn: 比如你打电话到办公室，对吧，问，哦，你能把我转接给卡罗尔吗？

segments.en: So can you connect me to another phone line?
segments.cn: 那你能把我连接到另一个电话线吗？

segments.en: Alright, now let's take a look at our next words.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们来看看下一个单词。

segments.en: Yes, the boss is very clever.
Alright, so if you're clever, you're... You're smart.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你聪明，你就是……你很聪明。

segments.en: So the boss is quite clever and this is a clever plan.
segments.cn: 所以老板相当聪明，这是一个聪明的计划。

segments.en: Now let's take a look at our last word.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看最后一个单词。

segments.en: To be greedy is a bad thing.
So like at lunch today, when you had that cake.
segments.cn: 就像今天午餐时，你吃了那块蛋糕。

segments.en: So these are some great words and I think, you know, if we listen to the dialogue another time, a little bit more slowly, we'll be able to hear them a little bit better.
segments.cn: 所以这些是一些很好的单词，我认为，如果我们再听一次对话，稍微慢一点，我们会听得更清楚。

segments.en: Alright, so this is what we're going to do.
segments.cn: 好的，这就是我们要做的。

segments.en: I've carefully mapped this out, so don't screw it up.
segments.cn: 我已经仔细规划好了，所以不要搞砸。

segments.en: Mr. Rabbit, you and Mr. Fox will go into the bank wearing these uniforms.
segments.cn: 兔先生，你和狐狸先生将穿着这些制服进入银行。

segments.en: We've managed to get replicas of the one the guards wear when they pick up the money.
segments.cn: 我们已经设法获得了保安在取钱时穿的制服的复制品。

segments.en: When you get inside, tell them that you're filling in for Carl and Tom and say that they're on another route today.
segments.cn: 进入后，告诉他们你是替卡尔和汤姆的，说明他们今天在另一个路线。

segments.en: What if they want to call and confirm?
segments.cn: 如果他们想打电话确认怎么办？

segments.en: We have the phones tapped, so the call will be patched through to me and I'll pretend to be the transport company.
segments.cn: 我们已经监听了电话，所以电话会转接给我，我会假装是运输公司。

segments.en: Only take as much money as you can fit into these bags.
segments.cn: 只拿你能装进这些袋子里的钱。

segments.en: Okay, so now we understand these words that we talked about in Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 好的，现在我们理解了在语言收获中讨论的这些单词。

segments.en: So now let's take a look at some of these great phrases in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 现在我们来看看流利构建中的一些很好的短语。

segments.en: We've got three phrases for you here and these are all phrases you might use when you're planning something.
segments.cn: 我们这里有三个短语，这些都是你在计划某事时可能会用到的短语。

segments.en: So the first one, mapped out.
So when you map something out, what do you do?
segments.cn: 所以当你规划某事时，你在做什么？

segments.en: Well, you literally create a plan.
segments.cn: 嗯，你实际上是在制定一个计划。

segments.en: You draw a map of what you're going to do.
segments.cn: 你画出你要做的事情的地图。

segments.en: So here, is it only for like travel or... No, no, no.
segments.cn: 所以这里，它仅仅是旅行吗，还是……不，不，不。

segments.en: It's like, for example, if we're starting a new project in the company, you can map out the project what you're going to do this month, next month, so it's a plan.
segments.cn: 比如说，如果我们在公司开始一个新项目，你可以规划出这个月、下个月你要做的项目，所以这是一个计划。

segments.en: So you draw every step in the plan.
segments.cn: 所以你画出计划中的每一步。

segments.en: So you said, well, I've mapped out this plan for a new project.
segments.cn: 所以你说，嗯，我为一个新项目规划好了这个计划。

segments.en: I think we should hear some examples of how it's used.
segments.cn: 我认为我们应该听一些它的用法示例。

segments.en: So I have the future all mapped out.
segments.cn: 所以我已经规划好了未来。

segments.en: Well, you'll get a job as a waiter, then we'll get married, and two years later we'll start having kids.
segments.cn: 嗯，你会找一份服务员的工作，然后我们会结婚，过两年我们会开始要孩子。

segments.en: We're mapping out the marketing plan at the meeting today.
segments.cn: 我们今天在会议上规划市场计划。

segments.en: Okay, I've mapped out our trip and it should take about 10 hours.
segments.cn: 好吧，我已经规划好了我们的旅行，应该大约需要10个小时。

segments.en: Let's take a look at our next word.
segments.cn: 让我们看看下一个单词。

segments.en: All right, so if you've mapped out a plan, you don't want to screw it up.
segments.cn: 好的，所以如果你已经规划好了一个计划，你就不想搞砸。

segments.en: So to screw something up means that you made a mistake on something.
segments.cn: 所以搞砸某事意味着你在某事上犯了错误。

segments.en: Okay, so for example, if I'm taking an exam and I make a mistake, I screwed up on the exam.
segments.cn: 好的，比如说，如果我在考试中犯了错误，我在考试中搞砸了。

segments.en: Or for example here, when we're recording, Marco and I make mistakes a lot.
segments.cn: 或者比如说在这里，当我们录音时，马尔科和我经常犯错。

segments.en: It's a really informal word but very, very common.
segments.cn: 这是一个非常非正式但非常常见的词。

segments.en: Yeah, you know, it sounds really, really natural when people use this.
segments.cn: 是的，你知道，当人们使用这个词时，听起来真的很自然。

segments.en: All right, so now let's take a look at our last word.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在我们来看看最后一个词。

segments.en: Why don't we just give you an example of a person that loses his or her cool.
segments.cn: 我们不如给你一个失去冷静的人的例子。

segments.en: What do you mean you're not ready to go?
segments.cn: 你是什么意思，你还没准备好去？

segments.en: so basically you lose your temper.
segments.cn: 所以基本上你失去脾气。

segments.en: You lose control of your emotions.
So Marco, when you lose your cool, is it always that you get angry?
segments.cn: 所以马尔科，当你失去冷静时，是否总是生气？

segments.en: Maybe you get irritated or impatient.
segments.cn: 也许你会感到恼火或不耐烦。

segments.en: So basically you're not in control of your emotions.
segments.cn: 所以基本上你对情绪失去控制。

segments.en: Okay, so we've looked at a lot of great phrases, a lot of great words.
segments.cn: 好的，我们已经看了很多很棒的短语和词汇。

segments.en: So we can listen to our dialogue now for the third time, and then we'll come back and talk about this bank robbery business.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以听第三遍对话，然后再回来谈谈这个银行抢劫的事。

segments.en: All right, so this is what we're going to do.
segments.cn: 好吧，这就是我们要做的。

segments.en: I've carefully mapped this out, so don't screw it up.
segments.cn: 我已经仔细规划好了，所以不要搞砸。

segments.en: Mr. Rabbit, you and Mr. Fox will go to the bank wearing these uniforms.
segments.cn: 兔子先生，你和狐狸先生将穿着这些制服去银行。

segments.en: We've managed to get replicas of the one the guards wear for when they pick up the money.
segments.cn: 我们设法得到了保安在取钱时穿的制服的复制品。

segments.en: When you get inside, tell them that you're filling in for Carl and Tom, and say that they're on another route today.
segments.cn: 进到里面后，告诉他们你是替卡尔和汤姆的，说明他们今天在另一个路线。

segments.en: What if they want to call and confirm?
segments.cn: 如果他们想打电话确认怎么办？

segments.en: We have the phones tapped, so the call will be patched through to me, and I'll pretend to be the transport company.
segments.cn: 我们已经监听了电话，所以电话会转接给我，我会假装是运输公司。

segments.en: Only take as much money as you can fit in these bags.
segments.cn: 只拿你能装进这些袋子里的钱。

segments.en: So there's a lot of movies about bank robberies, but obviously they happen in real life.
segments.cn: 所以有很多关于银行抢劫的电影，但显然它们在现实生活中也发生。

segments.en: So this dialogue is actually based on real events, right?
segments.cn: 所以这个对话实际上是基于真实事件，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, this actually happened in real life, and so it's actually a very creative and nonviolent way of robbing a bank.
segments.cn: 是的，这实际上在现实生活中发生过，所以这实际上是一个非常有创意且非暴力的抢银行方式。

segments.en: Basically, this guy went to a bank dressed up as one of those security guards that transport the money from the bank to another safe place.
segments.cn: 基本上，这个家伙穿着运输银行钱的保安的衣服去银行。

segments.en: He had fake credentials or replica credentials.
segments.cn: 他有假证件或复制证件。

segments.en: Yeah, he had a replica of the uniform.
segments.cn: 是的，他有制服的复制品。

segments.en: And he walked in, he took all these bags, him and his partner, and they took him to the truck and drove off, and the bank didn't realize that they had been robbed.
segments.cn: 他走进去，和他的搭档一起拿走了所有这些袋子，带到卡车上开走，银行没有意识到他们被抢了。

segments.en: They thought it was a routine thing.
segments.cn: 他们以为这是例行公事。

segments.en: Three or four hours later, the real security guard shows up.
segments.cn: 三四个小时后，真正的保安出现了。

segments.en: They were long gone, and they still can't find them.
segments.cn: 他们早已离开，至今仍找不到他们。
所以这是一个非常聪明的计划。

segments.en: I think they stole over half a million dollars.
segments.cn: 我想他们偷了超过五十万美元。

segments.en: Okay, well guys, don't try this at home.
segments.cn: 好吧，伙计们，别在家里尝试这个。

segments.en: Don't try this at home, but real life, real English, right?
segments.cn: 别在家里尝试这个，但这是现实生活，真实的英语，对吧？

segments.en: Okay, so come to our website.
Tell us what you think will happen with these guys.
segments.cn: 告诉我们你认为这些家伙会发生什么。

segments.en: Do you think they'll be successful?
Do you think they'll get caught?
segments.cn: 你认为他们会被抓住吗？

segments.en: Yeah, they might end up in jail.
segments.cn: 是的，他们可能会进监狱。

segments.en: Maybe somebody will lose their cool and get caught, right?
segments.cn: 也许有人会失去冷静被抓住，对吧？
